Contradict fact: The claim that the gunman suspected of the Florida school shooting was a registered Democrat contradicts the fact that it was based on faulty information and debunked reports.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the alleged political affiliation of the gunman without sufficient evidence or support.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on erroneous reports and rumors circulated after the shooting.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the political affiliation of the gunman is relevant or indicative of their actions.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim as it was found that the voter registration record used to support the claim did not belong to the suspected shooter.
